title: Rise in 4-wheeler sales, manufacturing PMI, & more

news.title: Rise in 4-wheeler sales, 2w sales decline
news.description:
Automakers released sales numbers for Dec'22. Here are the highlights:
Tata Motors: sold 2.28 lakh units- 14.3% higher that compared to Dec 2021.
Maruti Suzuki: sold 1.39 lakh units, 9% lesser.
M&M: sales rose 45% to 56,677 units.
Ashok Leyland: sold 18000 units - 45% higher.
Eicher Motors: sold 7,221 vehicles - 17% higher.
2 and 3-wheeler sales
Hero Moto: sold 3.94 lakh motorcycles and scooters - 0.2% lower than Dec 2021.
Bajaj Auto: sales stood at 2.81 lakh units - 22.3% lower.
TVS Motors: sales fell 3.6% to 2.42 lakh units.
Eicher Motor: sold 68,400 units - 7.2% lower.

news.title: More...
news.description:
+Sah Polymers IPO was subscribed 2.37 times. Retail investors subscribed 7.46 times. The IPO is open till 4 Jan.
+India’s purchasing managers’ index (PMI) for manufacturing (a measure of industrial production) rose to a 26-month high of 57.8 in December.
+Net corporate tax collection stood at Rs 7.12 lakh cr in the financial year 2021-22.
+Rishabh Instruments has filed draft papers with SEBI for an IPO.
+Coffee shipments from India rose 1.66% to 4 lakh tonnes in 2022.

news.title: Other stocks in news
news.description:
Hero Moto: started deliveries of its first electric scooter Vida V1.
Edelweiss Financial Services: will raise Rs 400 cr via debentures.
NCC: won orders worth Rs 3,601 cr in Dec.
PTC India: approved final dividend of Rs 5.80 per share.
Coal India: coal supply to the power sector rose 11% to 432.7 million tonne in the April-Dec period.

news.title: Word of the day
news.description:
SME
Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) are companies with a total revenue lesser than Rs 250 cr.
SMEs include both manufacturing and service companies.
Small enterprises = initial investment of less than Rs 10 cr. Revenue less than Rs 50 cr.Medium enterprises = initial investment of less than Rs 50 cr. Revenue less than Rs 250 cr.

news.title: 6-day course
news.description:
Theme: tax-saver mutual funds
Day 1: Monday
Investing in a particular type of mutual fund can give investors tax benefits.
These mutual funds are called Equity Linked Savings Scheme (ELSS). Tax-saver funds is another name for these mutual funds.
This week, we’ll discuss all about it.
Many investors make a mistake and think they can get tax benefits for their investment in any mutual fund.
This isn’t true.
A tax benefit is available only in case of ELSS funds.
In most mutual funds, you can invest and withdraw any time.
Tax saver funds have a lock-in period of 3 years.

news.title: Featured question
news.description:
"Won't it be better to withdraw and reinvest all money from stocks and MFs at the end of each year rather than take all of it out all at once? Doing the yearly thing would reduce net taxes as most of the money would fall under the non taxable 1L slab."
 
You could do that.
But remember, if you start taking out money early, you will also miss out on potential returns.
Many investors do use the technique that you’re suggesting.

introduction.content:
Happy New Year 2023!
Indian markets kicked off the new year with around 0.5% gains. They remained in the green throughout the session.
SGX Nifty was in the red, and US markets ended lower in their previous session. This usually signals a negative start for Indian markets.
Despite that, both indices gained through the day.
A few reports said markets rose because of the gain in metal stocks. Analysts shared a positive view on metal stocks due to the easing of curbs in China.
Nifty Metal was up 2.43% today, followed by Nifty PSE (Public sector enterprise), which was up 1.42%, and Nifty CDTY (Commodities) 1.28%.
Consumption and pharma indices were the only losers.
Fact: Nifty has risen between 0% and 1% about 501 times in the last 5 years.
